newsitem.title: VENEZUELA: PDVSA sees 300,000 bpd from new fields auctioned.
newsitem.headline: PDVSA sees 300,000 bpd from new fields auctioned.

text.p: Petroleos de Venezuela (PDVSA) said it expects to produce up to 300,000 barrels per day (bpd) of crude oil in the medium term from 20 oil areas offered in its third marginal auction announced Friday.
"This round aims at taking production to 300,000 barrels per day in the next 10 years," Energy and Mines Minister Erwin Arrieta told a press conference.
Present output from 700 wells in these 20 areas is about 66,000 bpd. The number wells in the area totals about 3,000 wells.
PDVSA Vice-President Claus Graf, speaking at the same news conference, said production from each of the fields in the auctioned areas was between 200 and 1,000 bpd.
"But in the short term, that can go up to between 2,000 and 5,000 barrels per day," he said.
Contracts with private investors will be for 20 years, Arrieta said, and up to six billion dollars in investment are expected during the period.
